page.title: 03FARMING(2)
page.content: grown. Woodman's Farm has 1200 acres in this area.It is used as follows: (a) 500 acres of rotational grassland to feed a 300 cow Dairy Unit,based at Avington Manor. (b) 700 acres of cereals which is made up of 500 acres of winter wheat and 200 acres of spring barley. Woodman's farm is immaculately kept and highly organised. He keeps Friesian dairy cows. He employs a manager,a full-time secretary and a game-keeper.The owner lives in a large farmhouse and is a well respected local personality. One point of interest is that part of his farm was used as a Military Camp during World War 1 (1914-18).Signs of this still exist eg rusty bedsteads,the remains of an old railway,which brought in supplies.
